str2: A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A purse, money-bag. Probably remotely from ballo; a pouch.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.
And, even, also, namely.
In like manner, similarly, in the same way, equally. Adverb from homoios; similarly.
A sack, wallet for carrying provisions. Of uncertain affinity; a wallet or leather pouch for food.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A sword. Probably feminine of a presumed derivative of mache; a knife, i.e. Dirk; figuratively, war, judicial punishment.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.
